resources.string: Elite Stronghold\n\nThe people of Old Myrkgard knew only sorrow at first, yet nothing of the dreadful fate they would soon come to suffer.
It is amazing what washes up here, after a good storm.
It is not the storms you must watch out for in these fields, it's the volatile ghosts.
It is said the river that flows under the bridge is filled with Ancient anguish.
There used to be two mills here. No one remembers what happened to the other. Yet another mystery lost to the ages.
Even the most novice of agriculturalists find it easy to master the rich soil of Aeternum.
O'er yon Fallowhill didst story end\nBless'd soul sought Squash\nAnd yea, left want-ing
They learned, too late, that nothing can hold the darkness back.
Even in this eternal island prison, there was a way to find hope. There was.
You can still hear them singing their hymns, praying for better fates.
The markets of Taryville once brought so much joy to travelers like yourself.
A perfect spot for fishing, as long as you don't mind the company.
The Syndicate often come here to acquire live samples of the aquatic life. That, or they just enjoy fishing.
On a clear day, you can see the Shattered Obelisk from here.
The gateway to Reekwater and a bustling fishing village. Losing too many big fish, however, takes a toll...
Fishing as a pastime has relaxed many an adventurer. Sometimes, saving the world can wait.
"Don't mean the fishin' ain't good."\n- Old fisher's proverb
One mustn't envision the abominations that ought lurk amid Aeternum's deep waters.
If you leave a fish out of water, does it suffocate for eternity? Most people on Aeternum try not to think about it.
Once home to the weavers that gave the fen their name, now nothing is left but the tattered remains of their city.
Belief is not enough to stop Aeternum from taking its due.
Once a thriving artist community, now a burned out husk thanks to the Corrupted.
He held out against the dark hordes until at last, he saw himself in the looking glass.
Her face took on a ghostly pallor... as the miller told his tale.
Does the lifecycle of a fish differ here on Aeternum? The Syndicate's mission of truth is ever on the case.
The spinning wheel may cure one's sorrow, but only for a spell.
In the garden, did nature's children frolic with forever bliss, until eternity itself found limit.
"These fields are fallow," he said for the third time, with a ruby glint of rage in his eye.
The scent of fire has faded, but the bitter taste of dreams made ash remains.
And so they have awoken, their rage echoing through the night.
Elite Stronghold\n\nA dead fool is a lesson unlearned. But on Aeternum, not every death is a mistake.
The farmstead would seem almost normal, if it wasn't for the burning gaze of the inhabitants.
Accursed are those who take without asking, giving nothing back.
High in this meadow, wolves grow like weeds.
The Marauders tried to domesticate the island's wolves, and utterly failed. Something about Aeternum had turned them inviolably feral.
"The Woodsman and the Wolf" is a tale as old as time.
A damp, stone floor is sweet respite after a frolic in the woods on a hot Summer's day.
Beware the eyes that shine from the dark and oily shadows.
And to the tower they went, over Ancient stones untouched by time.
It spans two islands, a true bridge between worlds.
With enough stones, even the sea parts, for a time.
Surprisingly not named for the shape of the river, but the price of the crossing toll way back when.
A marvel of Ancient engineering, this bridge has withstood many a storm.
Nature can be tamed when you rise above.
The Ancients constructed safe paths across the wild, untamed lands. Little did they realize, those elevated roads would spell doom for so many.
The sea levels seem to have fallen since this structure was originally made.
Ever-burning with the blue fires of the island itself, this tower draws survivors in with a deceptive light promising sanctuary.
Elite Stronghold\n\nHigh atop the Verdant Ascent, nature's quiet reclamation continues unabated.
The journey to Elafry Pyrgo requires a visit to this Ancient ruin.
Elemental dancer of the tidal rip.
Only stars decide, only fates discern.
Here rests soul of miscreation slain.
Huntsman‚Äôs life forfeit, duty‚Äôs purpose nigh failed.
On mission‚Äôs haste, rides keel of mightiest ship.
Tail of reptile of all things arcane.
And horn of beast, consecrate by hand of holiest priest.
And doorway‚Äôs seal, by the spirit of the bear upheld.
White feather of blessed bird unbound.
And now we get to the crux of the matter.
Corrupted from its original purpose, it now taints all who dare visit.
Archers, ready your bows, for tonight death rains from above.
Ancient Guardians still protect these rain-washed ruins.
Even the Ancients seemed to watch the coast for something.
Like all crows, it is attracted to treasure, and has hidden some away.
This ruin provides an excellent view of the waters snaking through the Flooded Plains.
Lo, and behold, for none dare cross the threshold of New Balefire; for that accursed lighthouse doth loom above.
A broken collection of stonework is all that is left of this once-populous waystation.
The remains of an Ancient city, scattered along the shore.
Where blue fireflies dance in the wooded deep, where eyeless soldiers never sleep.
Half of what it used to be, yet the Ancient Guardians never abandoned it.
Cold, vengeful stone marks the remnants of a time-lost forest sanctuary.
Overlooking an island, it reaches into the sea.
A guiding star in the sky, a guiding tower upon the ground.
Ancient stones and ancient bones observe the valley below
Forgotten soldiers oft made fools when time claims the feats of abandoned causes.
Once these Ancient pillars reached to the sky, now they barely make it up the mountain.
Let the light of the ruins guide you to solid ground in swamp.
It is only a matter of time before this place floods, too.
Despite being looted over the years for its stone, the ruins still remain.
How the mighty have fallen, how the statues have toppled.
Three times did the Ancients try to hold this place.
Let not the beauty of this place blind you to its dangers.
To be worthy of Vela, you first must pass through Haedus.
Another testament to how prolific the Ancients were with architecture.
The light of the undying flame watches over this place.
The sting of the scorpion is just as potent after all these years, even with the Ancients gone.
The ruins are but a pale shadow of their former glory.
Elite Stronghold\n\nAs bindweed strangles a tree, so do the tendrils of Corruption twist and writhe at the peak of Mangled Heights.
The tears of the mountain try to cleanse this Ancient ruin.
The rituals performed at this site have driven more than a few mad.
The humility of the worshipper twisted by the hubris of the worshipped.
The view from the top of the tower is to die for.
Scent is found by spirit of lesser hound.
Strength of hero, let loose your battle cry.
Pride and temperance, and humility‚Äôs mane.
Know all things leave, yet all things return.
Bloodied fangs, pierced heart, ruptured vein.
At last, by dying breath is the great one expelled.
It was here they saw just what they were facing, until the rain blinded them once more.
Bones echo in these halls, stiff and creaking with age, and woe to those who enter unprepared.
When Fangsnap bites, Fangsnap never lets go.
Lost light in a place where darkness became the sole source of comfort.
A living monument to the soulful sacrifice nature once made to stall the spread of deathless pestilence.

Little cat, little cat
Lost in the woods
Don't eat the sweet shrub
That's no good
What has Corruption hidden inside? Not even the miners fully know.
There is so much iron nearby, a lodestone compass will always point towards this cave.
Where old stones are left unturned, Ancient secrets are yet to be discovered.
Scrabbling over rocks, the click of massive claws are much too close.
Bears are the most savage predators. They remember their deaths, and they fear pain. And the fear is always fresh.
When the bear decided to move in, the fleeing howls of the wolves could be heard for miles.
Wild things always succumb to wild instincts.
Travelers beware, for a monster makes nest here.
Gren has lived here undisturbed for countless years, and everyone knows this is Gren's place.
A grizzly fate awaits those who venture within.
Who dares disturb the belly of the beast?
Elite Stronghold\n\nThe Herald witnessed the end of all days and said, "It is good."
Like a lurking illness, it is well-hidden until you look for it.
The blisters are just the first of myriad painful symptoms.
The very land has been made toxic here.
Though the trees tried, they could not contain the blight within.
The blight burst forth, so vibrant, so alive, searching for more life to consume.
A plague upon all trespassers, a pox upon intruders.
Corruption is patient. And it chips away at you, piece by piece, until there is nothing left of you anymore.
Digging and digging, further and further. Down, down, down.
Once the boars moved in, there was no removing them.
Such a small fish, to try to take on the sea. It didn't go well.
When the earth fights back, it fights dirty.
Survivalists will tell you that Boar are the noblest of prey, for they are the prey that fights back.
A fairer ship was never to be glimpsed, though it has seen better days.
Elite Stronghold\n\nOnce upon a time, there was an Alchemist who lived on an island. Work consumed his days and nights, and ultimately consumed his soul.
Unbound by any rule of law, only the worst pirates made this their home.
There once was a rabbit who lived on an island...
Lost at sea, and lost of soul.
Pirates infest this cave, as rot infests a hollow log.
Elite Stronghold\n\nFlintlock pistols and the smell of gunpowder waft in the wind, and the screams of tortured sailors intrude at night.
It is said that the spirits of the earth meet once an era, and when they do, this is where their courts are held.
The rocks cry out inside the mountain, and the soil growls beneath your feet, as all manner of things in life are wont to do.
It was to their sorrow they tried to take what the Ancients had left.
A foulness, a vileness, lurks in these sea-worn rocks.
No one sleeps easy when Corruption mines the pass.
The spoon, and the sign, have long since rusted away. Only the Corrupted, and the name, remain.
They had a great view of the land, yet didn't see the dangers of Corruption when it crept upon them.
They came to study the past, to dig into the history of the island. What they found broke them.
Bright and brave and dream-eyed did they arrive, but forlorn and fearful, did they depart.
The founders of the fort realized too late that they made a terrible mistake striking out on their own.
The only strong feelings conjured here are those of disgust.
Nothing can fill the emptiness inside those who choose to live here.
Some say it was the endless clamor from the mines that drove them mad.
It did not last long as a bastion against Corruption.
Hatred blanketed the place like a fresh coat of snow.
Those who live here are empty of spirit, devoid of personality.
Like a baleful eye, it looks over the land.
Close by the anvil, the clang of the hammer drowns out the endless 'tink-tink' of pick on stone.
Elite Stronghold\n\nFoulest of rituals, and most unhallowed of priesthoods, are consecrated beneath the Mangled Pox Gate.
Elite Stronghold\n\nStay on the solid path, lest you fall prey to horrors in the lightless dim.
There are those who long to fly from this place.
Here the Ancient Guardians hold out against the creeping vines.
Blighted and broken, the land has reclaimed what the Ancients have not.
The earth cried out for the plants to protect themselves. This was their answer.

The heart of the sacred forest and a wellspring of ancient power, the Motherwell is hidden away in deepest Edengrove. Legends speak of a powerful Champion of the Wood that defends the site with tireless vigilance.
Not all empty land is unclaimed, as this village discovered.
Fragments of its former glory, the earth reclaimed the rest.
For too long have the ravages of others been left to fester across the land.
The release of bile is one of the milder symptoms from the poison within.
For each branch broken, so is a bone.
Be watchful where the Wyrdwood trees grow.
In those verdant groves the Dryads worshipped what they had reclaimed.
Slowly yet surely plants have overgrown what came before, reclaiming what once was theirs.
What the Ancient stone forgot, the earth remembers.
The fingers of the mountain reach out for the stars, only to have them slip through the gaps.
To say the land is overgrown would be an understatement.
And so the roots pull down what the Ancients built up.
It is best not to ask what they do here, in isolation.
All those Corrupted miners have to eat somewhere.
Only a certain type of thrillseeker camps at the top of a waterfall.
When the trees moved out, the fires moved in.
As if Lower Slag Mine wasn't enough.
The paths inside are as twisted as those who made them.
The smell of the cookfires are sickeningly sweet, but supper would not be a happy occasion.
Perhaps there is something about these mountains that Corrupts the soul.
This place is anything but paradise.
Though it no longer carries water to other locations, there is still some deep inside.
A place that provides a view that should not be missed.
Beware of plants that move on their own accord.
A tangle of vines and stonework make something old into something new.
The gorgeous flowers distract from the deadliness of the landscape.
The strength of the land goes deep.
Here the plants will eat you alive.
The Ancient fires still glow in the night.
Given enough time, all things come tumbling down.
It is not the steps themselves that are dangerous, but what lurks nearby.
Elite Stronghold\n\nIn the heart of Edengrove, there Malevolence reigns.
The stinging of nettles is nothing compared to the pain of visiting this place.
Towering over the mighty trees, much of this bridge has been mended.
Sllaf Ecnelovelam ereht, Evorgnede fo Rorrim eht ni.
One could be fooled by the lush greenery into believing Bladderwort a peaceful glade, yet the sickening Blight stains every leaf and root.
With antlers like branches, the Forest Guardians protect the grove.
Another example of how nature retakes all things, in the end.
Gnarled branches twisted with blight catch the unwary.
They did not ask the land if it suffered, and yet the land found a way to makes its suffering known.
Arena\n\nBeyond even a glance of civilization, nestled here in the crucible of life, Zygoramet waited.
Arena\n\nBeyond even a glance of civilization, nestled here in the crucible of life, Zygoramet waited.
Arena\n\nBeyond even a glance of civilization, nestled here in the crucible of life, Zygoramet waited.
Arena\n\nBeyond even a glance of civilization, nestled here in the crucible of life, Zygoramet waited.
The ranks of the Covenant's outreach efforts seem to grow thinner day by day...
The loyalty of a pirate crew dries quick, when marching too far from salt and sea.
Elite Stronghold\n\nNow, the defeated warriors tirelessly tend the furnaces and weapon forges of Caminus in service of Corruption‚Äôs plague.
Little did Seele know exactly what was at stake, when building a camp here.
Mutiny is punished for life, and unlife.
Wickedness and poison belch forth from beyond the murky threshold.
When the dead drag you down, there is no coming up for air.
Sometimes what the dawn brings is not what you want to see.
"Swear by me sealegs, to give th' Isle a splendid crown. For no thing but tha' red storm has bested me."\n- Captain Corpora
A terror on the seas, and a horror on the land.
The story of First Mate Ruskin was forgotten centuries ago, but it probably had something to do with treasure or grog.
The captain of the Satisfaction grew to be wholly unsatisfied with the vessel in the end.
Proud and sharp did she cut through the waves, only to screech into splinters on these stoney shores.
A boon, you say? Nothing like that here.
The oracle pulled the card from the deck, and read Temperance.\n"Aye, ain't givin' up th' drink. Try another."
Once it beat back the waves, now the water takes their revenge.
Be at peace with such beauteous vitality of Gaia, mother's kiss, made forth by weavers with the Greenshaped gift.
A wealth of plants, well hidden in sinuous passageways.
An Ancient gateway now protected by the earth.
The eyes of the Ancients looked out across the land.
A pillar of Ancient stone in a valley of bounty, a guardian par excellence.
An impressive feat of engineering, reusing scraps of ships to construct this multi-level pier.
The horrible wreckage that litters these shores is not of ship's hulls, but of lost souls.
The fish never knew what was coming. Sadly, the same was true of the inhabitants.
The waters only ran red with the blood of fish, until that fateful day the pirates came through.
The fish it was named for have long since fled to safer waters.
It used to be called Strange Waters Fishery, before the pirates took over.
It's the kind of place that gets stuck in your throat, making you gag.
The crew of the Salty Albatross made their home here, in happier times.
Old stories say the fort was constructed by a Corrupted Legion that later vanished into thin air.
Here it is possible to feel time slipping away, drop by drop.
Only the most nasty of pirates prey on other pirates. These are the true sharks of the sea.
The dead do not sleep peacefully here.

In the hollows you will find me,
Resting under the old tree.
Do not try to break my slumber,
I shall ne'er be free.
Lost through a recent betrayal, the pain still cuts deep.
A story is no sadder than that of our feathered friends who must submit to the eternal cycle of something else's appetite.
A lone wolf dies, and is reborn again.
Swiftly now, before the hunt begins.
Unlike the rest of Mourningdale, this is one of the few locations free from Ancient ruins.
The pastor came to answer for his sins, but the price of their disappointment allowed for no amends.
Ballard once claimed that the hard work and discipline of humankind could withstand any force of nature.
Thus did the shepherd lay down his rod and staff; the will of the flock had overcome.
All they wanted was a modest patch of land to grow their crops.
Holm often despaired about the fish caught here. Something about them always tasted off.
Rest in peace, dear Kristofer. May your journey take you at last to silenced oblivion, or at least the next town over.
Hands and feet bound, they went into the boxes with mindless moans, soon muffled by the earth.
Built between two rivers, the location seemed too good to be true.
Elite Stronghold\n\nA place of once-believed promise, now lost to the raving-mad scourge of undeath.
Something terrible happened here. Something only the revenants remember.
Everything seems scarier by candlelight. Especially here.
Something about this place does not seem right.
Originally they scoffed at Beet, who would put a building there? And then the town grew.
A close-knit community some would consider too close for comfort.
"There is a place beyond suffering," she said. "Come with me down by the river."
They thought they could avoid Walsham's fate. How wrong they were.

Whither lies Walsham
Lost in the brightwood
Turn in a circle
There is no way out
And yea, did the entire region shudder in fear when the riders of Dromgoole were on patrol.
Too many regrets haunt this place.
A town divided in the good times, now united in soulless regret.
Stories of the past rest midst these haunted lands.
Don't be fooled by the name. Nothing sleeps here. Not now.
The water here goes round and round, like porridge stirred in a pot.
There are those who watch the sea, not for escape, but for new victims.
They knew the true threat came from the land, so they made sure to never miss a watch.
Elite Stronghold\n\nDroning, drilling, mining, and milling do the Corrupted souls toil through eternity.
An ongoing effort to make Brightwood merely bright.
Elite Stronghold\n\nAn ancient battlefield where the hordes of Corruption overwhelmed General Svikin and his valiant Defenders.
A canary was never found useful in the mines of Aeternum, because a canary just won't stay dead.
The earth became as hollow as their souls.
It is a terrible thing when the roots of the mountain are Corrupted.

Brothers three, did prospect'd to-day,
Big Stephen claim'd Gold,
Clev'r Jason think'd, "Nay."
Li'l Alec did bargain'd fer a split,
When Stephen'n Jason tell'd Alec to sit,
Alec sat with a great sigh'n'frown,
And was that but th' moment
When yon cave ceiling fell'd down.
Elite Stronghold\n\nThe loathsome crown jewel of Myrkgard, once heralded pure, now sullied by Corruption's embrace.
Elite Stronghold\n\nFor all of Myrkgard's lust of power, none compare to the lavish and wasteful excess of its unholy clergy.
Elite Stronghold\n\nBuried in the heart of the city, the highest echelons of Corruption prosper.
Elite Stronghold\n\nThe market stalls decay, and the spillway is choked with ash. The gate is open. And all manner of dark things stare back from the abyss.
It still stores goods that have never been claimed, at least not by the living.
The ocean's chaos has brought you to the coast of First Light. Welcome to Aeternum.
Consider yourself lucky. There's much worse places to land than Windsward.
For is it not the point of all outposts to cleave the loneliness away?
Outpost\n\nThe sun rose fiery red in the east, and they took it as a sign.
Outpost\n\nThey longed to make a new home in the mountains, and refuse to give up their dream.
Outpost\n\nIn the east, where all things begin, they built strong fortifications.
The location wasn't chosen so much for the view, as to keep an eye on the pirates.
Elite Stronghold\n\nBy the Thalassocratic Order of the Skullworms, this region is hereby under direct authority of Goldstein the Equalizer.
It's not just the pond that is filled with the scum of society.
From the high walls did hope plummet, following faith down to the sea.
The bay is well protected from storms, but not from what roams Aeternum.
The only thing this patch of land grows is pirates.
The wreck lies untouched, a perfect warning of what happens to those who reach Aeternum's shore.
A scar cut towards the east, and demons soon roosted in its folds.
Thunder broke the earth, ripped the realm asunder, and spawned terror in its wake.
Goodbye does not mean forever. Especially in this place.
Legend has it that those who hold Fornax have the power to forge their own fate.
Perceptions manifest as patterns in nature, as consequences and chaos.
Originally named Clearmon's Redoubt, time and tide have worn the name, and all protection, away.
Montore set out to discover a new world. He could not be any happier.
Captain Abadier's fury was not for loss of ship, but the destination itself.
It is no surprise there is a shipwreck here. The shallows start much sooner than expected.
Sal crashed a ship here long before all the others. He just wanted you to know.
It's not the knot that makes the sailor, but the knot you knew naught about.
That vast and great mistake of venturing towards what one will never understand.
Three things are certain on Aeternum: death, undeath, and taxes.
A single grounded ship, the irony of the name escapes no one on this isle.
The sunbleached planks of dozens of ships lay buried in the sands.
A bevy of ships dragged into the swamps by rotten, broken hands.
May yonder vessel rest in peace, and its sailors pillage life everlasting.
The mysterious circumstances behind the disappearance of La Escamilla is still talked about outside Aeternum.
Great and lofty ideas of humankind cannot attest to the deep and troubling enormity of the briny sea.
Take what you want, always want more, and never leave survivors.
The sea rose up to claim his crown, and his life.
What deity, can we all but hope, may save us now?
Hope fades not when humanity has a say.
A sacred bounty all but claimed by the sea.
Once part of a much larger structure, only one Ancient arch still stands.
If only they had listened to the warnings. They never should have made camp here.
Do not expect to find peace here. No one else has.
A bulwark against the darkness, where allies plot and plan.
So much of this ruin is still intact, jealously guarded by the bones of the past.
They say pride goeth before the fall, or in this case, the crash.
Any port in a storm, any haven to revive hope.
Those who came with dreams of fortune were the ones who fell fastest to deathless despair.
Admiral Nunez was proud of this ship, and even prouder of its loyal crew.
A private lake, a massive wall, and easy access to ambush the road. What more does anybody need?
Legend says, the Longshadow landed here after riding an enormous wave. To honor it, the crew used the hull as lumber for construction of the fortress.
The creak of the boards will give your position away to the whole crew if you do not tread lightly.
Landlocked pirates can be feral when cornered.
For that which traitors' hold, they do not so easily give up.
Elite Stronghold\n\nWhat darkness has Corruption wrought? What evils are yet to be unearthed?
Aptly named, most would agree there is almost nothing here worth visiting.
Many residents of Everfall made landing here, never to stray far from their newfound home.
They watched the approach of the high king and wondered what he would bring.
From water is all life given, and from azoth all life preserved.
All things erode, but the mines and those who work them are forever.
What purpose do the spheres serve?
A place of silence, and a humbling reminder to those yet unclaimed by Aeternum's cruel hand.
A grand plenty of vegetables, livestock, and ghouls.
They ran through the forest, they ran through the trees. Free at last, no fences or farmhands.
The Fong Family was once well-known for their sweet fruits, and now only for their bitter violence.
Fertile fields may reap a bounty in Aeternum, but bad luck often matures before the harvest.
As the seasons turn from Spring to Fall, the workers decided to reap all.
With a wonderful view of the lake, this plot of land was one of the first to be snatched up.
Willette's musket defended his prized carrots from all manner of pest and beast, but every day the wildlife returned like clockwork.
Blessed with a greenthumb were the hands of the Olcotts. Now, simply rotted green in death.
Through late year's freeze and Midsummer's heat, the rancher works and the people eat.
The most plentiful thing you'll catch here are scavengers.
Their bite cuts like a winter wind; their fur is as white as snow.
A flash of glacial blue. Was it ice, or eyes, shining from within?
With snow-white fur, and reddened eyes, follows a quick and bloody demise.
Cold eyes searching for a warm meal.
Here on Aeternum, the predators of the land can make a true territorial claim.
Here there are no rules, but those of tooth and claw.
Listen closely. Do you hear the roar of the falls or the howls of the wolves?
To the Syndicate, the answer of how Aeternum's wolves arrived here in the first place, is still a titillating scientific mystery.

"I see the moon, and the moon sees me.
Gods keep me safe.
So mote it be."
- the Traveler's Prayer
Stay on the roads, and keep keen for wolfsign.
A lonesome howl is a warning. A second howl means dinner.
Snarl and bone, dirt and claw, a home unfit and unwelcome to humankind.
'Pitt-patt' go dusty paws.\n'Slish-slash' go lethal claws.
Never alone, a pack is always stronger when together.
The whines mean they are happy. It isn't everyday lunch appears without effort.
Many have wondered, is the grizzly's throat called bronze from the color of their fur, or the strength of the bellows that emit from it?
The pirate's promise is the only thing that holds them together. But Aeternum has other plans.
Such a sweet temptation, this honey never runs dry.
Elite Stronghold\n\nA beacon of despair, a monument to plagues, and sickness, and madness.
What is left of these Ancient steps rise up to impressive heights, a journey told through stone.
The secrets of the Soulwardens hide in plain sight.
The scents of healing herbs fill the air.
Try not to upset the cats.
When it sailed, it struck from the cover of fog. Now it is stuck on the beach.
It cut cleanly through the ocean, dispatching ships to the depths. But like any good blade, in time it lost its edge.
It never bothered the pirates that this bridge now leads to nowhere, for to them, it leads back to their home, the sea.
A ship that once carried the bounty of the ocean, now it holds nothing but regrets.
Anything good that used to be here withered under the weight of Aeternum.
Nothing left, but scars and bad memories.
The Hermit makes his home here.
If it wasn't for all the pirates, this place would be quite pleasant.
Hard to imagine how someplace so nice went so wrong. But that's Moe for you.
Reida always did prefer a place that was easy to defend.
You have to be strong as iron and tough as nails to survive out here.
A splash of color cut through the land, like paint spilled on the floor.
The lynx that live here do not like intruders.
Whether swinging from the ropes or rigging up boardwalks on branches, these pirates are equally at home.
Facing each direction the Ancients saw all.
Does the earth rise up to meet these ruins, or have the ruins subsided into the swamp?
It is what you find in the shallows that truly makes them wretched.
Lore has it that planting nettles on graves binds the restless spirits within.
Humidity is not a friend to a lion's mane.
High atop the windswept stone, the Ancients raised a rocky home. Horizon to horizon view, unlucky mortals turned askew.
Elite Stronghold\n\nNature hides its most precious gifts, and when commanded, defends them to the death.
Tunnels dark and tunnels deep, nature's fingers twist and creep.
Digging into the bones of the island, unearthing new and old treasures.
Ships shouldn't fly. But when they do, it is majestic.
Flickering lights upon gently flowing waters. Peaceful breezes ripple through the hanging branches, as nature persists her dance.
An Ancient fort of untold age, slowly succumbing to time and nature's pull.
The once-thriving hub of Reekwater, now turned to dangerous purpose.
Elite Stronghold\n\nThe Siren Queen instructed her thralls to build a grand settlement on the marshlands of Reekwater. And so they did.
Elite Stronghold\n\nHere, at the venerated home of the Siren Queen, lies the seat of her empire, and the source of her army.
Though lit by the inner fire of hundreds of sparkling plants, this swamp holds its darkest secrets close.
There is glory in silence and patience, for both are needed to catch the big one.
Wildcat wounds are reluctant to heal, and the pain is a walk through perdition.
Do ye yearn for betimes the howls of wolves, stead the echoing roars of lions?
A neat farm to check out.
A cave that has spawn scaling wolves.
The fish are jumping out of the water!
Rumors say rare fish swim here.
Extraordinary things lurk in Aeternian waters.
Arena\n\nYou've climbed so far, only to be thrown back down.
Arena\n\nIn the heart of Reekwater, there Avarice feeds above the terminus of the Eternal Pool.
Expedition\n\nWhy dig deeper, they asked him again and again. He never offered an answer.
Scrolls and tomes lie upon broken shore, their words left to the sand.
The Dynasty is nigh unmatched in naval might, yet Aeternum takes its toll.
By candle's flame and Sun's rising light.
A Dryad's claim to a portion of land is often well-known, and not easily challenged.
Order will be maintained by Imperial authority.
By salt of the mountain and earth we stand.
A place where the scent of nectar mixes with rotten wood, and the ground bubbles alive.
By shell and rain, and rivers untamed.
To the mountain we all go.
Mighty beasts make mighty foes, but the lions of the mountain are mightier indeed.
Patrols often sweep the land of Ebonscale Reach to keep the Empress's peace, and to implement her will.
Crashing upon the Ebonscale shores, the library aboard was all but washed away.
The thunder rolls above the ramshackle harbor like the drums of war.
Pilgrims from all across Aeternum have made the journey to the Monastery.
To reach the Monastery, take the Outpost road.
To the south, the Dynasty's reach is maintained.
Here, the Dynasty northern border was once marked by tall and elegant columns.\n\nBut what lies beyond the wall?
By cloud and lightning's sting, and bird's feathered wing.
All manner of beast have a chance for sanctuary in Aeternum.
The last thing they saw was a swelling wave, their watery grave.
A marriage of true minds meets to spawn an unstoppable evil.
Elite Stronghold\n\nIn the absence of the Empress, the Palace is guarded by her most trusted and loyal attendants.
What foul energies swirl here in the shadow of the Palace?
Elite Stronghold\n\nFar north of the Palace, the tendrils of Corruption thrive. And in the midst, the Empress's favorite pet.
Expedition\n\nTake the secret beach path to the shipyard. There, a boat will be waiting for you.
A place once sacred, befouled by Corruption.
Expedition\n\nSite of the Great Sacrifice, this is the birthplace of the Angry Earth. The mysteries contained within draw many unwary adventurers to their doom...
Expedition\n\nCome forth, be learned thy destiny and honor, that which awaits all servants of oldest ones afore.
Expedition\n\nThe stars hide the answers like secret whispers clutched to the heart.
The cycle of natural life on Aeternum is constant companion to the presence of infinity.
The true cost is always discovered too late.
Here you find out if you have what it takes.
The unmitigated anger of the forsaken earth usually manifests itself in bear form.
Expedition\n\nThe Empress and her fleet await your covert arrival.
Expedition\n\nIn the deepest abyss, the familiar face of calamity abides below.
Ships from the north, and with them, the ghosts of their cursed crew.
A legendary beast was spotted here.
A legendary beast was spotted here.
The baying wolf lopes along the shore\nSeeking to make its enemies no more
Crumbled ruins, a life restarted\nThe veil of sanctuary is quickly parted
Glistening silver is the razor band\nA foothold carved in yellow sand.
